page.title: 05Local History of Bognor
page.content: The Saxons probably called Bognor Boecgo-Nor.Then it became Bognor Rocks. { Until the 1790's Bognor Rocks used to be a little fishing town. The smugglers used it to import goods. { {Sir Richard Hotham}was the founder of Bognor.He built the{Dome House, {Spencer Terrace, Mordington }and {St.Michaels}which made up Hothampton Cresent in the 1790's.He also built an {Ice House }and a {Chapel House. {King George}stayed in Bognor in 1929 because he was very ill.He came over because people said Bognor is a place where he could recover.Then he said Bognor would be called Bognor{Regis } in honour of his stay and recovery.
